result.markdown:
--- title: "Week 4: Grouping and Summarising" date: October 19 toc: true --- Before we do any exercises, make sure to run this code: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .code-overflow-wrap} library(tidyverse) dat <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BrighamEaquinto/brighameaquinto.github.io/master/datasets/insurance.csv") ``` ::: This is our dataset for this practice: > | age|sex | bmi| children|smoker |region | charges| > |---:|:------|------:|--------:|:------|:---------|---------:| > | 19|female | 27.900| 0|yes |southwest | 16884.924| > | 18|male | 33.770| 1|no |southeast | 1725.552| > | 28|male | 33.000| 3|no |southeast | 4449.462| > | 33|male | 22.705| 0|no |northwest | 21984.471| > | 32|male | 28.880| 0|no |northwest | 3866.855|
## Let's learn about `group_by()` & `summarise()` What if we want to learn: - the average BMI ***by*** gender - the total sum of charges ***by*** region in the US - min & max of children ***by *** age All of these are examples uses for `group_by()` and `summarise()` statements.
# Examples ## Examples 1: Average BMI by Gender ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dat %>% group_by(sex) %>% summarise(Average_Age = mean(age)) ``` ::: > |sex | Average_Age| > |:------|-----------:| > |female | 39.50302| > |male | 38.91716| ## Examples 2: Average BMI by Age ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dat %>% group_by(age) %>% summarise(mean(bmi)) %>% head() ``` ::: > | age| mean(bmi)| > |---:|---------:| > | 18| 31.32616| > | 19| 28.59691| > | 20| 30.63276| > | 21| 28.18571| > | 22| 31.08768| > | 23| 31.45446| # Practice Exercises ## Exercise 1: Sum of Charges by Region Use the code below to get you started. Find the sum of the charges by region. **Starter Code:** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dat %>% group_by(______) %>% summarise(_____________ = ___(_______)) ``` ::: Attempt the code above then use this dropdown for help ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true" code-summary="Answer"} dat %>% group_by(region) %>% summarise(Total_Charges = sum(charges)) ``` ::: This is the correct output: > |region | Total_Charges| > |:---------|-------------:| > |northeast | 4343669| > |northwest | 4035712| > |southeast | 5363690| > |southwest | 4012755| ## Exercise 2: Min & Max of Children by Age Use the code below to get you started. Find the minimum and maximum amount of children by age. **Starter Code:** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dat %>% group_by(___) %>% summarise( Min = ___(________), Max = ___(________) ) %>% head() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true" code-summary="Answer"} dat %>% group_by(age) %>% summarise( Min = min(children), Max = max(children) ) %>% head() ``` ::: This is the correct output: > | age| Min| Max| > |---:|---:|---:| > | 18| 0| 4| > | 19| 0| 5| > | 20| 0| 5| > | 21| 0| 4| ## Exercise 3: Average Charges by Sex and by Smoker Here no starter code is given. If you need to, look back at previous code chunks for guidence. Try as best as possible to mimic the results below. Only use the dropdown answer when you've tried as much as possible. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true" code-summary="Answer"} dat %>% group_by(sex, smoker) %>% summarise( Average_Charges = mean(charges), Total_Charges = sum(charges)) ``` ::: This is the correct output: > |sex |smoker | Average_Charges| Total_Charges| > |:------|:------|---------------:|-------------:| > |female |no | 8762.297| 4792977| > |female |yes | 30678.996| 3528085| > |male |no | 8087.205| 4181085| > |male |yes | 33042.006| 5253679| ## Exercise 4: Storm Dataset - Wind and Air Pressure This dataset is bult into R so you already have it. It is called `storms`. This is a new dataset so you may want to either `view()` it or use the `head()` method on it. Find the average and standard deviation of the wind speed and air pressure by storm category. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true" code-summary="Answer"} storms %>% group_by(category) %>% summarise( mean(wind), sd(wind), mean(pressure), sd(pressure) ) %>% knitr::kable() ``` ::: This is the correct output: > |category | mean(wind)| sd(wind)| mean(pressure)| sd(pressure)| > |:--------|----------:|--------:|--------------:|------------:| > |-1 | 27.49482| 3.702448| 1007.5390| 3.900209| > |0 | 45.66392| 8.231625| 999.2910| 6.837831| > |1 | 70.95140| 5.454009| 981.1887| 9.125784| > |2 | 89.41923| 3.873391| 966.9359| 9.018024| > |3 | 104.48157| 4.246545| 953.9124| 9.168259| > |4 | 122.10462| 6.383000| 939.3942| 9.788015| > |5 | 145.58140| 5.862072| 917.4070| 12.732892| ## Exercise 5: Summarizing by Month Find the mean, median, and standard deviation of wind speed by month. Only use the dropdown answer when you've tried as much as possible. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true" code-summary="Answer"} storms %>% group_by(month) %>% summarise( Mean_Wind = mean(wind), Median = median(wind), St_Dev = sd(wind) ) ``` ::: This is the correct output: > | month| Mean_Wind| Median| St_Dev| > |-----:|---------:|------:|---------:| > | 1| 50.33333| 50| 12.312969| > | 4| 44.61538| 45| 5.937711| > | 5| 36.27778| 35| 9.011887| > | 6| 37.55348| 35| 12.676257| > | 7| 41.74973| 40| 18.711162| > | 8| 51.75471| 45| 25.584917| > | 9| 57.54597| 50| 28.192273| > | 10| 56.49272| 50| 25.795906| > | 11| 53.30986| 50| 22.702523| > | 12| 47.88000| 45| 14.608659| ## Exercise 6: Airquality Dataset - Summarising by Month This example is very similar to the previous example. This is a new datset and hopefully doing the same thing with another dataset will solidify the concept. This dataset is bult into R so you already have it. It is called `airquality`. This is a new dataset so you may want to either `view()` it or use the `head()` method on it. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true" code-summary="Answer"} airquality %>% group_by(Month) %>% summarise( Mean_Wind = mean(Wind), Median = median(Wind), St_Dev = sd(Wind) ) ``` ::: This is the correct output: > | Month| Mean_Wind| Median| St_Dev| > |-----:|---------:|------:|--------:| > | 5| 11.622581| 11.5| 3.531450| > | 6| 10.266667| 9.7| 3.769234| > | 7| 8.941935| 8.6| 3.035981| > | 8| 8.793548| 8.6| 3.225930| > | 9| 10.180000| 10.3| 3.461254|
